thread.title: Men’s Basketball: Niang, Burton, Morris receive Big 12 honors
thread.title_full: Men’s Basketball: Niang, Burton, Morris receive Big 12 honors

title: Men’s Basketball: Niang, Burton, Morris receive Big 12 honors
text:
Men’s Basketball: Niang, Burton, Morris receive Big 12 honors Men’s Basketball: Niang, Burton, Morris receive Big 12 honors 
Iowa State's Georges Niang, left, was selected as a preseason All-Big 12 first-team member while Monte Morris was an honorable mention choice. File Photo by Brian Achenbach/Special to the Tribune By Bobby La Gesse rlagesse@amestrib.com 
Iowa State forward Georges Niang earned All-Big 12 first-team honors, paving the way for three Cyclones who received preseason recognition from the league on Thursday. 
Forward Deonte Burton was selected as the newcomer of the year and guard Monte Morris received honorable mention all-league honors. 
Niang, who was a unanimous selection, led the Cyclones with 15.3 points last season. He also averaged 5.4 points and was second on the team with 117 assists. He nabbed third-team All-American honors from the Associated Press last season. 
Burton is a transfer from Marquette and will be eligible after the first semester concludes. He was named to the Big East All-Rookie team in 2013-14. 
Morris led the Big 12 with 5.2 assists last season. He also averaged 11.9 points and 3.4 rebounds while earning second-team all-league honors.
